1: <sup>1</sup> Blessed are the undefiled in the way, who walk in the law of the LORD.
2: <sup>2</sup> Blessed are they that keep his testimonies, and that seek him with the whole heart.
3: <sup>3</sup> They also do no iniquity: they walk in his ways.
4: <sup>4</sup> Thou hast commanded us to keep thy precepts diligently.
5: <sup>5</sup> O that my ways were directed to keep thy statutes!
6: <sup>6</sup> Then shall I not be ashamed, when I have respect unto all thy commandments.
7: <sup>7</sup> I will praise thee with uprightness of heart, when I shall have learned thy righteous judgments.
8: <sup>8</sup> I will keep thy statutes: O forsake me not utterly.
9: <sup>9</sup> Wherewithal shall a young man cleanse his way? by taking heed thereto according to thy word.
10: <sup>10</sup> With my whole heart have I sought thee: O let me not wander from thy commandments.
11: <sup>11</sup> Thy word have I hid in mine heart, that I might not sin against thee.
12: <sup>12</sup> Blessed art thou, O LORD: teach me thy statutes.
13: <sup>13</sup> With my lips have I declared all the judgments of thy mouth.
14: <sup>14</sup> I have rejoiced in the way of thy testimonies, as much as in all riches.
15: <sup>15</sup> I will meditate in thy precepts, and have respect unto thy ways.
16: <sup>16</sup> I will delight myself in thy statutes: I will not forget thy word.
17: <sup>17</sup> Deal bountifully with thy servant, that I may live, and keep thy word.
18: <sup>18</sup> Open thou mine eyes, that I may behold wondrous things out of thy law.
19: <sup>19</sup> I am a stranger in the earth: hide not thy commandments from me.
20: <sup>20</sup> My soul breaketh for the longing that it hath unto thy judgments at all times.
21: <sup>21</sup> Thou hast rebuked the proud that are cursed, which do err from thy commandments.
22: <sup>22</sup> Remove from me reproach and contempt; for I have kept thy testimonies.
23: <sup>23</sup> Princes also did sit and speak against me: but thy servant did meditate in thy statutes.
24: <sup>24</sup> Thy testimonies also are my delight and my counsellors.
25: <sup>25</sup> My soul cleaveth unto the dust: quicken thou me according to thy word.
26: <sup>26</sup> I have declared my ways, and thou heardest me: teach me thy statutes.
27: <sup>27</sup> Make me to understand the way of thy precepts: so shall I talk of thy wondrous works.
28: <sup>28</sup> My soul melteth for heaviness: strengthen thou me according unto thy word.
29: <sup>29</sup> Remove from me the way of lying: and grant me thy law graciously.
30: <sup>30</sup> I have chosen the way of truth: thy judgments have I laid before me.
31: <sup>31</sup> I have stuck unto thy testimonies: O LORD, put me not to shame.
32: <sup>32</sup> I will run the way of thy commandments, when thou shalt enlarge my heart.
33: <sup>33</sup> Teach me, O LORD, the way of thy statutes; and I shall keep it unto the end.
34: <sup>34</sup> Give me understanding, and I shall keep thy law; yea, I shall observe it with my whole heart.
35: <sup>35</sup> Make me to go in the path of thy commandments; for therein do I delight.
36: <sup>36</sup> Incline my heart unto thy testimonies, and not to covetousness.
37: <sup>37</sup> Turn away mine eyes from beholding vanity; and quicken thou me in thy way.
38: <sup>38</sup> Stablish thy word unto thy servant, who is devoted to thy fear.
39: <sup>39</sup> Turn away my reproach which I fear: for thy judgments are good.
40: <sup>40</sup> Behold, I have longed after thy precepts: quicken me in thy righteousness.
41: <sup>41</sup> Let thy mercies come also unto me, O LORD, even thy salvation, according to thy word.
42: <sup>42</sup> So shall I have wherewith to answer him that reproacheth me: for I trust in thy word.
43: <sup>43</sup> And take not the word of truth utterly out of my mouth; for I have hoped in thy judgments.
44: <sup>44</sup> So shall I keep thy law continually for ever and ever.
45: <sup>45</sup> And I will walk at liberty: for I seek thy precepts.
46: <sup>46</sup> I will speak of thy testimonies also before kings, and will not be ashamed.
47: <sup>47</sup> And I will delight myself in thy commandments, which I have loved.
48: <sup>48</sup> My hands also will I lift up unto thy commandments, which I have loved; and I will meditate in thy statutes.
49: <sup>49</sup> Remember the word unto thy servant, upon which thou hast caused me to hope.
50: <sup>50</sup> This is my comfort in my affliction: for thy word hath quickened me.
51: <sup>51</sup> The proud have had me greatly in derision: yet have I not declined from thy law.
52: <sup>52</sup> I remembered thy judgments of old, O LORD; and have comforted myself.
53: <sup>53</sup> Horror hath taken hold upon me because of the wicked that forsake thy law.
54: <sup>54</sup> Thy statutes have been my songs in the house of my pilgrimage.
55: <sup>55</sup> I have remembered thy name, O LORD, in the night, and have kept thy law.
56: <sup>56</sup> This I had, because I kept thy precepts.
57: <sup>57</sup> Thou art my portion, O LORD: I have said that I would keep thy words.
58: <sup>58</sup> I intreated thy favour with my whole heart: be merciful unto me according to thy word.
59: <sup>59</sup> I thought on my ways, and turned my feet unto thy testimonies.
60: <sup>60</sup> I made haste, and delayed not to keep thy commandments.
61: <sup>61</sup> The bands of the wicked have robbed me: but I have not forgotten thy law.
62: <sup>62</sup> At midnight I will rise to give thanks unto thee because of thy righteous judgments.
63: <sup>63</sup> I am a companion of all them that fear thee, and of them that keep thy precepts.
64: <sup>64</sup> The earth, O LORD, is full of thy mercy: teach me thy statutes.
65: <sup>65</sup> Thou hast dealt well with thy servant, O LORD, according unto thy word.
66: <sup>66</sup> Teach me good judgment and knowledge: for I have believed thy commandments.
67: <sup>67</sup> Before I was afflicted I went astray: but now have I kept thy word.
68: <sup>68</sup> Thou art good, and doest good; teach me thy statutes.
69: <sup>69</sup> The proud have forged a lie against me: but I will keep thy precepts with my whole heart.
70: <sup>70</sup> Their heart is as fat as grease; but I delight in thy law.
71: <sup>71</sup> It is good for me that I have been afflicted; that I might learn thy statutes.
72: <sup>72</sup> The law of thy mouth is better unto me than thousands of gold and silver.
73: <sup>73</sup> Thy hands have made me and fashioned me: give me understanding, that I may learn thy commandments.
74: <sup>74</sup> They that fear thee will be glad when they see me; because I have hoped in thy word.
75: <sup>75</sup> I know, O LORD, that thy judgments are right, and that thou in faithfulness hast afflicted me.
76: <sup>76</sup> Let, I pray thee, thy merciful kindness be for my comfort, according to thy word unto thy servant.
77: <sup>77</sup> Let thy tender mercies come unto me, that I may live: for thy law is my delight.
78: <sup>78</sup> Let the proud be ashamed; for they dealt perversely with me without a cause: but I will meditate in thy precepts.
79: <sup>79</sup> Let those that fear thee turn unto me, and those that have known thy testimonies.
80: <sup>80</sup> Let my heart be sound in thy statutes; that I be not ashamed.
81: <sup>81</sup> My soul fainteth for thy salvation: but I hope in thy word.
82: <sup>82</sup> Mine eyes fail for thy word, saying, When wilt thou comfort me?
83: <sup>83</sup> For I am become like a bottle in the smoke; yet do I not forget thy statutes.
84: <sup>84</sup> How many are the days of thy servant? when wilt thou execute judgment on them that persecute me?
85: <sup>85</sup> The proud have digged pits for me, which are not after thy law.
86: <sup>86</sup> All thy commandments are faithful: they persecute me wrongfully; help thou me.
87: <sup>87</sup> They had almost consumed me upon earth; but I forsook not thy precepts.
88: <sup>88</sup> Quicken me after thy lovingkindness; so shall I keep the testimony of thy mouth.
89: <sup>89</sup> For ever, O LORD, thy word is settled in heaven.
90: <sup>90</sup> Thy faithfulness is unto all generations: thou hast established the earth, and it abideth.
91: <sup>91</sup> They continue this day according to thine ordinances: for all are thy servants.
92: <sup>92</sup> Unless thy law had been my delights, I should then have perished in mine affliction.
93: <sup>93</sup> I will never forget thy precepts: for with them thou hast quickened me.
94: <sup>94</sup> I am thine, save me: for I have sought thy precepts.
95: <sup>95</sup> The wicked have waited for me to destroy me: but I will consider thy testimonies.
96: <sup>96</sup> I have seen an end of all perfection: but thy commandment is exceeding broad.
97: <sup>97</sup> O how I love thy law! it is my meditation all the day.
98: <sup>98</sup> Thou through thy commandments hast made me wiser than mine enemies: for they are ever with me.
99: <sup>99</sup> I have more understanding than all my teachers: for thy testimonies are my meditation.
100: <sup>100</sup> I understand more than the ancients, because I keep thy precepts.
101: <sup>101</sup> I have refrained my feet from every evil way, that I might keep thy word.
102: <sup>102</sup> I have not departed from thy judgments: for thou hast taught me.
103: <sup>103</sup> How sweet are thy words unto my taste! yea, sweeter than honey to my mouth!
104: <sup>104</sup> Through thy precepts I get understanding: therefore I hate every false way.
105: <sup>105</sup> Thy word is a lamp unto my feet, and a light unto my path.
106: <sup>106</sup> I have sworn, and I will perform it, that I will keep thy righteous judgments.
107: <sup>107</sup> I am afflicted very much: quicken me, O LORD, according unto thy word.
108: <sup>108</sup> Accept, I beseech thee, the freewill offerings of my mouth, O LORD, and teach me thy judgments.
109: <sup>109</sup> My soul is continually in my hand: yet do I not forget thy law.
110: <sup>110</sup> The wicked have laid a snare for me: yet I erred not from thy precepts.
111: <sup>111</sup> Thy testimonies have I taken as an heritage for ever: for they are the rejoicing of my heart.
112: <sup>112</sup> I have inclined mine heart to perform thy statutes alway, even unto the end.
113: <sup>113</sup> I hate vain thoughts: but thy law do I love.
114: <sup>114</sup> Thou art my hiding place and my shield: I hope in thy word.
115: <sup>115</sup> Depart from me, ye evildoers: for I will keep the commandments of my God.
116: <sup>116</sup> Uphold me according unto thy word, that I may live: and let me not be ashamed of my hope.
117: <sup>117</sup> Hold thou me up, and I shall be safe: and I will have respect unto thy statutes continually.
118: <sup>118</sup> Thou hast trodden down all them that err from thy statutes: for their deceit is falsehood.
119: <sup>119</sup> Thou puttest away all the wicked of the earth like dross: therefore I love thy testimonies.
120: <sup>120</sup> My flesh trembleth for fear of thee; and I am afraid of thy judgments.
121: <sup>121</sup> I have done judgment and justice: leave me not to mine oppressors.
122: <sup>122</sup> Be surety for thy servant for good: let not the proud oppress me.
123: <sup>123</sup> Mine eyes fail for thy salvation, and for the word of thy righteousness.
124: <sup>124</sup> Deal with thy servant according unto thy mercy, and teach me thy statutes.
125: <sup>125</sup> I am thy servant; give me understanding, that I may know thy testimonies.
126: <sup>126</sup> It is time for thee, LORD, to work: for they have made void thy law.
127: <sup>127</sup> Therefore I love thy commandments above gold; yea, above fine gold.
128: <sup>128</sup> Therefore I esteem all thy precepts concerning all things to be right; and I hate every false way.
129: <sup>129</sup> Thy testimonies are wonderful: therefore doth my soul keep them.
130: <sup>130</sup> The entrance of thy words giveth light; it giveth understanding unto the simple.
131: <sup>131</sup> I opened my mouth, and panted: for I longed for thy commandments.
132: <sup>132</sup> Look thou upon me, and be merciful unto me, as thou usest to do unto those that love thy name.
133: <sup>133</sup> Order my steps in thy word: and let not any iniquity have dominion over me.
134: <sup>134</sup> Deliver me from the oppression of man: so will I keep thy precepts.
135: <sup>135</sup> Make thy face to shine upon thy servant; and teach me thy statutes.
136: <sup>136</sup> Rivers of waters run down mine eyes, because they keep not thy law.
137: <sup>137</sup> Righteous art thou, O LORD, and upright are thy judgments.
138: <sup>138</sup> Thy testimonies that thou hast commanded are righteous and very faithful.
139: <sup>139</sup> My zeal hath consumed me, because mine enemies have forgotten thy words.
140: <sup>140</sup> Thy word is very pure: therefore thy servant loveth it.
141: <sup>141</sup> I am small and despised: yet do not I forget thy precepts.
142: <sup>142</sup> Thy righteousness is an everlasting righteousness, and thy law is the truth.
143: <sup>143</sup> Trouble and anguish have taken hold on me: yet thy commandments are my delights.
144: <sup>144</sup> The righteousness of thy testimonies is everlasting: give me understanding, and I shall live.
145: <sup>145</sup> I cried with my whole heart; hear me, O LORD: I will keep thy statutes.
146: <sup>146</sup> I cried unto thee; save me, and I shall keep thy testimonies.
147: <sup>147</sup> I prevented the dawning of the morning, and cried: I hoped in thy word.
148: <sup>148</sup> Mine eyes prevent the night watches, that I might meditate in thy word.
149: <sup>149</sup> Hear my voice according unto thy lovingkindness: O LORD, quicken me according to thy judgment.
150: <sup>150</sup> They draw nigh that follow after mischief: they are far from thy law.
151: <sup>151</sup> Thou art near, O LORD; and all thy commandments are truth.
152: <sup>152</sup> Concerning thy testimonies, I have known of old that thou hast founded them for ever.
153: <sup>153</sup> Consider mine affliction, and deliver me: for I do not forget thy law.
154: <sup>154</sup> Plead my cause, and deliver me: quicken me according to thy word.
155: <sup>155</sup> Salvation is far from the wicked: for they seek not thy statutes.
156: <sup>156</sup> Great are thy tender mercies, O LORD: quicken me according to thy judgments.
157: <sup>157</sup> Many are my persecutors and mine enemies; yet do I not decline from thy testimonies.
158: <sup>158</sup> I beheld the transgressors, and was grieved; because they kept not thy word.
159: <sup>159</sup> Consider how I love thy precepts: quicken me, O LORD, according to thy lovingkindness.
160: <sup>160</sup> Thy word is true from the beginning: and every one of thy righteous judgments endureth for ever.
161: <sup>161</sup> Princes have persecuted me without a cause: but my heart standeth in awe of thy word.
162: <sup>162</sup> I rejoice at thy word, as one that findeth great spoil.
163: <sup>163</sup> I hate and abhor lying: but thy law do I love.
164: <sup>164</sup> Seven times a day do I praise thee because of thy righteous judgments.
165: <sup>165</sup> Great peace have they which love thy law: and nothing shall offend them.
166: <sup>166</sup> LORD, I have hoped for thy salvation, and done thy commandments.
167: <sup>167</sup> My soul hath kept thy testimonies; and I love them exceedingly.
168: <sup>168</sup> I have kept thy precepts and thy testimonies: for all my ways are before thee.
169: <sup>169</sup> Let my cry come near before thee, O LORD: give me understanding according to thy word.
170: <sup>170</sup> Let my supplication come before thee: deliver me according to thy word.
171: <sup>171</sup> My lips shall utter praise, when thou hast taught me thy statutes.
172: <sup>172</sup> My tongue shall speak of thy word: for all thy commandments are righteousness.
173: <sup>173</sup> Let thine hand help me; for I have chosen thy precepts.
174: <sup>174</sup> I have longed for thy salvation, O LORD; and thy law is my delight.
175: <sup>175</sup> Let my soul live, and it shall praise thee; and let thy judgments help me.
176: <sup>176</sup> I have gone astray like a lost sheep; seek thy servant; for I do not forget thy commandments.
